event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Use fmdump -v -e -u EVENT_ID to get information on the detected error(s).

The event-id can be found in the EVENT-ID field of the message.

For example:

    EVENT-ID: d05a9f16-e969-4988-d340-dea1b54bd307
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: An error has been detected in a system which currently does not support diagnosis.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:  %MSGID% indicates a memory error was detected by your system. Diagnosis is not currently available for this system, please use fmdump -v -e -u EVENT_ID to gather more information on the error and open a call to your Sun Service provider.

Note: You may also be requested to provide a copy of the files in the /var/fm/fmd directory and also a copy of the output from the fmadm config command.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The error log will need to be manually examined using fmdump(1M) in order to determine if any human response is required.
event_registry_properties.name: po-action
event_registry_properties.item: Use fmdump -ev -u <EVENT-ID> to view and record the undiagnosed errors.
event_registry_properties.name: po-description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager received an event from the IO subsystem for which automated diagnosis software is currently unavailable.
event_registry_properties.name: po-impact
event_registry_properties.item: The error log will need to be manually examined using fmdump(1M) in order to determine if any human response is required.
event_registry_properties.name: po-response
event_registry_properties.item: The error information has been saved for examination by Sun.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
